item.title: Ranger config
item.description: For navigating large folders I currently use Ranger: "A VIM-inspired file manager for the console". Ranger uses it's own file opener Rifle. This post show how to by pass this and use xdg-open. Configuration If you haven't used Ranger before the first step is to copy the default configuration by running the command $ ranger --copy-config=all This will copy the default files to your ~/.
